intro: Brasilicereus estevesii, commonly known as the Estevés cactus, is a species of cacti native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months, typically in spring or early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
